data.title: Make overview ruler border less obtrusive
data.body: Fixes #5099 by making the overview ruler's border less obtrusive on dark color themes, and by adding an option to hide it entirely.

data.title: Provide extensions a way to localize their messages
data.body:
Hi there,

after publishing a well-known extension, we want to reach even more people, even them, who don't know English that well(like me). So, after all, we want that everybody understands how they can make there dreams come true with icons they like and how they contribute with there own icon-mapping. And the way, obviously, is: Having any message in there first language, but we need the help of you.

In fact, we are in need of the language settings. Could you provide us any way how we can determine which language the UI is?(in the best way via package.json, because the commands are just supporting one language) 

Thanks

data.title: Multicursor highlighting on selection behaves oddly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type the text `XXXXXX`
2. Select the first `X`
3. Hit cmd-D multiple times. The selection will grow exponentially:

![t](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/50314/23344401/af98e044-fc49-11e6-80f3-af1054ca8dc1.gif)

I expected each cmd-D keypress to select the next X.

Furthermore, the "highlight all" behaves similarly oddly: It will highlight _pairs_ of whatever you selected:

![t2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/50314/23344473/096e8032-fc4b-11e6-93ee-3c7e1f90d68f.gif)

Even weirder, if you replace the text, then undo, any adjacent selections are collapsed (so it doesn't undo the selection properly):

![t3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/50314/23351704/b173a006-fc90-11e6-9059-0d10959523d3.gif)

1. Type 20 Zs.
2. Select one Z and "highlight all". There are now 10 selections of 2 characters each (wrong).
3. Type "p" to replacing all of them. You get 10 p's (wrong).
4. Undo. There are now 5 selections of 4 characters each (wrong).
5. Type "p" to replace all of them again. You get 5 p's (wrong).
6. And so on.

data.title: Can't close the tab of a deleted file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|vscode-caniuse|akamud|0.5.3|
|vscode-javascript-snippet-pack|akamud|0.1.5|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.2|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file
2. Write some text. Keep it open and navigate to any other file.
3. Delete that file. The file wil be deleted but its tab will remain open as it doesn't have the focus.
4. Navigate to any other file.
5. Go back to that deleted file in the files tab
6. Try to close thee tab of that deleted file. It will ask for saving it but you won't be able to 'cause you can't save a deleted file
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24493773/23344091/257b4922-fc55-11e6-86f1-15c65b6d6c9c.png)

data.title: Any plans for resolving JS function parameter types from .d.ts?
data.body:
If somebody for various reasons needs to keep the code itself as plain ES6 javascript (in .JS files), but is using .d.ts files for VSCode assistance (which in indeed incredible!), would it be possible to derive the types of the function parameters not from the JSDoc @ param but from the .d.ts itself?

Right now, any **other** file, importing a module, can benefit from the type information in .d.ts - but the module itself **cannot**.

Is this something being cooked in the vscode secret labs, just not finished yet? Is there a roadmap item  for this?

Thanks vscoders for the awesome tool!

data.title: Expand line selection does not select all of wrapped line

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: latest

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable line wrapping
2. Go to a wrapped line
3. Run the `expandLineSelection` command e.g. `cmd+i`

Expected: all lines in the wrapped line will be selected

Actual: only the current line of the wrapped line is selected

data.title: Order folder by groups
data.body: It would be great to be able to order the folders by groups.

data.title: Allow Cloning Git repositories using ssh instead of http
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Fedora 25

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select Clone Git repository
2. Enter git@github.com:Matt-1-2-3/random_junk.git 

This works in Git CLI and Pycharm IDE but VS Code is expecting only HTML link e.g. https://github.com/Matt-1-2-3/random_junk.git

Also I should mention that if you initially clone via ssh and the git command line, VS code will then happily push changes via ssh afterwards.

data.title: Multi-line pastes are handled improperly when using multiple carets
data.body:
- VSCode Version: v1.9.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy multi-line text to the clipboard
2. Create multiple carets (2 is sufficient)
3. Paste the clipboard contents

Expected behavior: the full contents of the clipboard are pasted at the location of each caret
Actual behavior: one line of the keyboard is pasted to the location of each of the carets

![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1909883/23341572/0583a08c-fc42-11e6-8bd3-57c257c90110.gif)

data.title: Degrees character '' is corrupted on saving a file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|format-php|Kasik96|1.1.2|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Load a source file containing, for example, strchr(str,''), for editing.
2. Save file with cntl-s, without touching this statement.
3. Re-load file to find that '' has been changed to hieroglyphics.
4. VS2015 does not do this, and MSVC 6.0 compiles it into something other than the degrees symbol.
5. If VSCode is then used to examine this line of code, the single quotes contain a question mark inside a diamond, and if this is then changed to '' by VSCode it then seems to persist OK.

data.title: Retrigger completions on accept
data.body:
I'm developing a language server and is providing completions on import paths.
In my language, a directory can not be imported. I have therefore set `/` as an completion
trigger so that files are automatically suggested. So far does everything work as expected.

However when a folder is accepted by the user I would like to add a trailing slash in the
insertText to help the user know that he or she must continue the path, but when I do that
the completion list is not automatically opened again and the user must press `ctrl+space`,
or type a character, or remove the `/` and type it again.
If I don't insert the `/` and let the user type it manually, the completions open as expected.

I think that if a trigger character is specified as the last character of the insert text it should
be treated the same as if the user had typed it manually and thus retrigger the completions.

data.title: Auto-Import should use tslint's quote setting
data.body:
Some folks use single quotes, some double quotes. This feature should look at the selected setting in `tslint.json`

```
    "quotemark": [
      true,
      "single"
    ],
```

- VSCode Version: Insiders 1.10.0
- Mac OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

1. use auto import

![auto import](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1202528/23340160/7f1d6894-fbff-11e6-828c-51ce2c2f950c.gif)

data.title: C++ Code Highlighting Fails For Large Files - Broken Again
data.body:
In regards to issue #11597 

I updated VSCode to 1.91, and C/C++ for Visual Studio Code  0.10.1.

When opening large files. The start (roughly first 10k lines) looks ok, but towards the end everything starts to go BLUE. 

This image is at the start of the file: http://pasteboard.co/CXVwq2zzU.png

This image is at the end of the file: http://pasteboard.co/CXW1KVxHg.png

Notice the difference in colouring of brackets ( {}, [] and ()) and the excessive blue in pretty much every other token. It's as if the editor has gone to Smurfsville post line 10k. 

The files used:
- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ArashPartow/exprtk/master/exprtk.hpp
- https://github.com/ArashPartow/strtk/blob/master/strtk.hpp
- https://github.com/ArashPartow/wykobi/blob/master/wykobi.inl

In short: Would it be *possible* to do whatever it is you're doing for the first ~10K lines for all the lines in the file?  

As I don't believe there's any need for differential treatment of lines post 10K.


@ramya-rao-a 
@aeschli 
@alexandrudima 
@chrmarti 
@joaomoreno

data.title: Setting to disable sound when using backspace in Integrated Terminal?
data.body:
This could just be me, but when using the **Integrated Terminal** with _"terminal.integrated.shell.windows"_  set to **powershell.exe** and deleting characters with **backspace** there is a high-pitched, old-school **sound warning** when there are no more characters to delete back. It would be wonderful if there is a setting to disable that sound, like _"terminal.integrated.sound": "false"_

I also recorded the audio [here ](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/10976481/vscode-sound.wav)

- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

data.title: Paste to Replace File Contents Shows Old Colorization Locations while Computing new Colorizations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.10-insiders b2a55bd66eb60af11c60ddd61b7581538b216051 - OS Version: Mac OS 10.11.6 **Steps to Reproduce** 1. Open this large js file in VSCode: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/mattbierner/34dbc249be0ebddedcc275d0ff40281b/raw/985dbbfba9a5db89f9cea618ce3c885ccc46ef8b/cmu.js 2. Scroll to the end of the file 2. Using an external program, create a copy of this file that replaces `data` with some longer string such as `data22222`. 1. Back in VSCode, select all and paste the modified file content into the editor **Bug** Before Replacement: After Replacement: After about 20 seconds, the new correct colorization is shown: In this case, I feel it would make more sense to show the new content as white, which is how the file is displayed when you first open it

data.title: Replace In File very Slow For Many Replacements
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10-insiders b2a55bd66eb60af11c60ddd61b7581538b216051
- OS Version: Mac OS 10.11.6

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Open this 4.5mb json file in VSCode: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zeke/cmu-pronouncing-dictionary/master/index.json
2. Perform a simple text replacement, such as `"` to `'`

**Bug**
This hangs the entire UI for about 15 seconds. For comparison, in completely non-scientific testing:

* Text Edit and Text Wrangler can do the same in well under a second.
* Text Mate takes about 7 seconds
* Atom - ??? but over 2 minutes

**Suggested Fixes**
* Investigate why this hangs the UI instead of just freezing the editor
* Show some sort of indicator while the operation is taking place. Right now, it feels like the app has crashed
* Investigate improving find/replace performance in files

data.title: [IntelliSense] [JavaScript] Go to Definition Doesn't Use Source Map
data.body:
- VSCode Version: v1.9.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu v16.10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Bundle a collection of JavaScript files local to the project and generate a source mapping.
2. Import the bundle.
3. Go to definition on any symbol present in the bundle.

The expected result is to go to the definition in the local JavaScript files. The actual result is to go to the definition in the bundle.

## [Example 1](https://github.com/niedzielski/vscode-map-go-to-def) (very tiny)

1. Open test/index.js.
2. Control-click the `foo` import.

The expected result is to go to the definition of foo in src/index.js. The actual result is to go to the definition in the build product, build/index.js.

## [Example 2](https://github.com/wikimedia/applib/blob/c6b0866/test/CollapseElement.js#L7)
We transpile and bundle our code to applib.js and a corresponding map, applib.js.map. The code that is exercised by our unit tests comes from this bundle directly. This is partially due to the suggested Rollup configuration but also means the same code exercised is the same code distributed. Unfortunately, go to defintion of `applib.CollapseElement.getTableHeader` goes to the bundled code instead of the original sources under `src/`.
